intro: Putoria calabrica var. gypsacea, commonly known as the Gypseous Putoria, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific arid regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its succulent leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand extreme drought conditions. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest in botanical studies. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
